fws.overview: Koxland Ecommerce is a modern, fully responsive, PWA-ready online store built with Next.js 15, Tailwind CSS v4, Shopify Storefront API, and Firebase Firestore. It’s designed for high performance, scalability, and real-world production use, featuring a persistent shopping cart, user-specific wishlist, product reviews with images (via Cloudinary), and full Shopify checkout integration. The project includes internationalization (i18n), smooth page transitions with Framer Motion, offline support, and the ability to be installed as a mobile app on iOS/Android. It follows a clean, modular architecture optimized for SEO and SSR and is deployed on Vercel. It is an open-source, production-ready e-commerce template for building scalable storefronts with Next.js, Firebase, and Shopify, following best practices for performance, UX, and maintainability.

sacbe.overview: A modern, fully responsive tour booking platform built with Next.js, React, and Tailwind CSS, designed to deliver a seamless travel planning experience. The platform allows users to explore and book tours in top destinations across Mexico and selected locations worldwide. It features a clean, user-friendly interface, dynamic filtering options, and an optimized booking process for travelers on both desktop and mobile devices. Users can browse curated tours with detailed information, pricing, and real-time availability, making it easy to plan trips with confidence. The project is being developed with a scalable, modular architecture to ensure high performance, SEO optimization, and readiness for integrations with APIs such as payment gateways, real-time availability systems, and multi-language support. The platform is currently under active development, with upcoming features including user accounts, personalized recommendations, multi-language support (English/Spanish), and enhanced search capabilities.

couponGenerator.overview: Coupon Cards is a responsive, multi-language digital coupon platform built with React 19, Vite, and Tailwind CSS 4. It provides tourists in Mexico and the Dominican Republic with easy access to promotional offers from major fast-food chains in premium destinations such as Cancún, Tulum, Los Cabos, Puerto Vallarta, and Punta Cana. The platform verifies user eligibility via an API call that checks the email and reservation code through Sacbe Transfers’ reservation endpoint. Eligible users can browse and filter coupons by region, view promotion details, and save offers directly to Apple Wallet or Google Wallet for convenience on the go. Key features include multi-language support (English/Spanish) using i18next, a clean and mobile-first UI, region-based filtering, and wallet integration. It follows a modular, component-based structure for scalability and maintainability. The project is deployed on Vercel, using ESLint, Prettier, and Tailwind’s Prettier plugin for consistent code formatting. Future improvements include user accounts, an admin panel for coupon management, analytics integration, and support for more tourist destinations.

threadhive.title: ThreadHive, Community Platform
threadhive.description: A next-generation community platform combining social discussion with gamification and complete brand identity. ThreadHive demonstrates end-to-end product development from strategic naming and visual design to full-stack implementation. Features include: WoolPath achievement system with 200+ custom-designed badges, NSFW content detection using TensorFlow.js, real-time notifications via Firebase, rich text editing with Tiptap, comprehensive moderation tools with role-based access, and privacy-controlled communities. Tech stack: Next.js 15, React 19, MongoDB, Redux + Zustand + TanStack Query for state management, JWT authentication, and Vercel deployment. Includes complete custom branding (mascot design system, naming strategy, visual identity) conceptualized and executed alongside technical development.

threadhive.overview: ThreadHive is a next-generation community platform that reimagines social discussion through comprehensive gamification and unique brand identity. It demonstrates complete end-to-end product development—from strategic branding and visual design to full-stack implementation and production deployment. The platform combines modern social features with an advanced achievement system (WoolPath) featuring 200+ custom-designed badges across 6 rarity tiers, creating engaging user progression and retention. Technical highlights include client-side NSFW content detection using TensorFlow.js, real-time notifications via Firebase Firestore, rich text editing with Tiptap, and sophisticated moderation tools with granular role-based access control (owner, moderator, member, banned, shadowbanned). Built with Next.js 15, React 19, Tailwind CSS v4, and MongoDB Atlas, ThreadHive implements distributed state management combining Redux (authentication), Zustand (UI state), and TanStack Query (server state caching). Features include threaded discussions with visual connectors, multi-image post galleries with Vercel Blob storage, privacy-controlled SubHive communities (public, private, NSFW, official), JWT authentication with refresh tokens, and internationalization support (English/Spanish). The project includes complete custom branding—strategic naming (Thread + Hive), mascot design system with multiple contextual variations, and cohesive visual identity across all platform touchpoints. Optimized for performance with SSR, responsive design for all devices, smooth transitions via Framer Motion, and deployed on Vercel with CI/CD integration. A production-ready demonstration of modern full-stack development, product thinking, and design execution.
